snippet: A new willingness to talk raises hope of a peaceful resolution to a conflict that has driven thousands of civilians from their homes in search of refuge.
abstract: Rebel forces halt their advance on Bangui, capital of Central African Republic, and say they are prepared to enter into peace talks with government; development raises hope of peaceful resolution to conflict that has driven thousands of civilians from their homes in search of refuge.

byline.contributor: Hippolyte Marboua contributed reporting from Bangui, Central African Republic.

lead_paragraph: A new willingness to talk raises hope of a peaceful resolution to a conflict that has driven thousands of civilians from their homes in search of refuge.

headline.seo: Central Africa on the Brink, Rebels Halt Their Advance
